abstracts.cdata!:
This is the project completion report
            (PCR) for the Kirimiro Rural Development Project. The
            project aimed at: (a) assisting smallholders to improve the
            productivity of their holdings, and thereby increase their
            food consumption and income, through the provision of
            inputs, the strengthening of extension services and the
            implementation of appropriate erosion control measures; (b)
            improving rural living conditions by building of maintaining
            water sources, equipping social centers and developing wood
            resources to be used as fuel wood, building poles and
            timber; and (c) improving the quality of Burundi coffee by
            building washing stations. The project signaled a change
            from the Government's previous agricultural development
            strategy. Instead of centralized governmental departments
            being used to develop coffee production, Regional
            Development Companies (RDCs) were to be created as
            decentralized agencies, to be made responsible for the
            integrated development of their respective regions
            (foodcrops, coffee, infrastructure, erosion control). One
            RDC was therefore set up under this project to carry out the
            activities that had previously been the responsibility of
            separate departments.

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the project completion report
            (PCR) for the Kirimiro Rural Development Project. The
            project aimed at: (a) assisting smallholders to improve the
            productivity of their holdings, and thereby increase their
            food consumption and income, through the provision of
            inputs, the strengthening of extension services and the
            implementation of appropriate erosion control measures; (b)
            improving rural living conditions by building of maintaining
            water sources, equipping social centers and developing wood
            resources to be used as fuel wood, building poles and
            timber; and (c) improving the quality of Burundi coffee by
            building washing stations. The project signaled a change
            from the Government's previous agricultural development
            strategy. Instead of centralized governmental departments
            being used to develop coffee production, Regional
            Development Companies (RDCs) were to be created as
            decentralized agencies, to be made responsible for the

Burundi - Kirimiro Rural Development Project
            : Credit 1165 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Burundi - Kirimiro Rural
            Development Project : Credit 1165 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The major components of the proposed
            project are: (a) a program to provide extension services and
            agricultural inputs; (b) construction and equipping of 6
            coffee washing stations and 12 handpulping centers and
            improvement of the operation and maintenance of all
            handpulping centers; (c) afforestation and erosion control
            measures; (d) improvement of the road and water supply
            network; (e) pilot activities; (f) studies, research,
            training and project monitoring; and (g) technical assistance.

0.cdata!:
Projet de developpement rural du
            Kirimiro - Burundi

abstracts.cdata!:
The major components of the Kirimiro
            Rural Development Project for Burundi are: (a) a program to
            provide extension services and agricultural inputs; (b)
            construction and equipping of 6 coffee washing stations and
            12 hand-pulping centers and improvement of the operation and
            maintenance of all hand-pulping centers; (c) afforestation
            and erosion control measures; (d) improvement of the road
            and water supply network; (e) pilot activities; (f) studies,
            research, training and project monitoring; and (g) technical assistance.
